summary: Completed comprehensive testing of ODIN ATC Console Phase 1 POC. Backend successfully fetching 138 aircraft from OpenSky Network. Frontend layout and UI components working correctly, but MapLibre GL JS map rendering is completely broken - map canvas area appears black with no aircraft visualization.

critical_bugs.issue: MapLibre GL library not loading/initializing - map canvas area completely black
critical_bugs.impact: No aircraft visualization, no map rendering, core functionality broken
critical_bugs.details: MapLibre GL import failing - library not available in global scope despite being installed in package.json v5.11.0

integration_issues.issue: Aircraft data from backend not being visualized due to map rendering failure

passed_tests: Frontend AIR bar displays ODIN logo, Bay Area region correctly
Live Local/UTC clocks updating every second
Status badge shows data polling status (LIVE · 2s tick)
Weather and runway placeholders show '—' correctly
Left filters panel renders with checkboxes for Runways and Traffic
Right info panel shows empty state message correctly
Disabled switches for Weather, Incidents, Heatmap present
All required data-testid attributes present for testing
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix MapLibre GL JS import/initialization issue. The library is installed (v5.11.0) but not loading in browser. Check import statements, bundling configuration, or potential React 19 compatibility issues. Map rendering is completely broken - no canvas elements created, no aircraft visualization possible.

success_percentage.frontend_layout: 95% - All UI components except map rendering
success_percentage.overall: 60% - Core functionality blocked by map issue
